actions.in_committee: House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs
actions.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended).
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs. H. Rept. 101-239.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 149.
Mr. Vento moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Mr. Lagomarsino demanded a second on the motion to suspend the rules.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
On ordering a second Agreed to without objection.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate, read twice.
Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.
Cleared for White House.
Measure Signed in Senate.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 101-108.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on National Parks and Public Lands

official_title: To provide for the relocation of certain facilities at the Gateway National Recreation Area, Sandy Hook, New Jersey, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Authorizes the Secretary of the Interior and the Secretary of Transportation to exchange certain real property in order to relocate and reconstruct a trailer court and to facilitate the construction of a marine sciences laboratory at the Gateway National Recreation Area, Sandy Hook, New Jersey. Authorizes appropriations.

titles.title: To provide for the relocation of certain facilities at the Gateway National Recreation Area, Sandy Hook, New Jersey, and for other purposes.
